story.text: SAN FRANCISCO Jan 2 Distributor Arrow Electronics Inc. said on Tuesday it would pay $485 million in cash to acquire smaller rival Agilysys KeyLink Systems Group. KeyLink is a Cleveland, Ohio-based distributor of computer servers, storage equipment and software in the United States and Canada, Arrow (ARW.N) said. Arrow said that with the purchase, Melville, New York-based Arrow will be the leading distributor of computer products for International Business Machines Corp. (IBM.N) and Hewlett-Packard Co. (HPQ.N) The purchase will add 18 cents to 22 cents per share in earnings over the first 12 months of its closing, it said. Agilysys has about 500 employees and is expected to have 2006 sales of about $1.6 billion, Arrow said.
story.title: arrow to buy smaller rival for $ 485 million
